header.title: How to create a PDF document for each tab
header.abstract: This How-To describes the generation of a PDF document for each group of documents that is defined by a tab.

audience.title: Intended Audience
audience.p: Users who need to generate one printable document aggregated from a group of documents.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.p: By default Forrest generates a pdf file for each separate document of your project. As well you can create a pdf of the whole site. But sometimes it may be necessary to generate a pdf file out of selected tab, i.e. only for certain parts of the site.

ul.li: Understand how to create project-specific sitemaps by following the Using Forrest document.

steps.title: Steps
steps.p: The procedure outlined below will define a project sitemap.xmap and create a new pdf-tab.xmap based on the aggregate.xmap

section.title: Create your project's main sitemap.xmap
section.p: Simply copy the sitemap.xmap from the Forrest sitemaps at ${FORREST_HOME}/context/sitemap.xmap into your src/documentation directory (or wherever ${project.sitemap-dir} points to).

section.title: Create the aggregator sitemap pdf-tab.xmap
section.p: Copy the aggregate.xmap from Forrest sitemaps into your ${project.sitemap-dir} and rename it to pdf-tab.xmap

section.title: Edit project sitemap.xmap
section.note: This is a workaround for Issue FOR-202
section.p: Edit the project sitemap.xmap to comment-out the match for the sitemap like this:
section.source: <!-- <map:pipeline internal-only="false"> <map:select type="exists"> <map:when test="{project:sitemap}"> <map:mount uri-prefix="" src="{project:sitemap}" check-reload="yes" /> </map:when> </map:select> </map:pipeline -->

section.title: Edit project sitemap.xmap to mount pdf-tab.xmap
section.p: Insert the following lines after the <map:match pattern="site.xml"> pipeline in the isection called "SOURCE FORMATS".

section.title: Edit the file pdf-tab.xmap
section.p: The <map:match pattern="*.xml"> element should look like the following:
section.source: <map:match pattern="*.xml"> <map:generate src="cocoon://abs-linkmap"/> <map:transform type="xpath"> <map:parameter name="include" value="//*[@wholesite='true']"/> </map:transform> <map:transform src="resources/stylesheets/site2book.xsl" /> <map:transform src="resources/stylesheets/aggregates/book2cinclude.xsl"> <map:parameter name="title" value="{conf:project-name}: Still My Foo Site"/> </map:transform> <map:transform type="cinclude"/> <map:transform src="resources/stylesheets/aggregates/doc2doc-uniqueids.xsl"/> <map:transform src="resources/stylesheets/aggregates/docs2document.xsl"/> <map:serialize type="xml"/> </map:match>

section.title: Edit your site.xml
section.p: Add in your site.xml in the about element <whole_foosite href="pdf-tab.html" label="sub site" /> Your site.xml should look like the following.
section.source: ... <about label="About"> <index label="Index" href="index.html" description="Welcome to MyProj"/> <changes label="Changes" href="changes.html" description="History of Changes" /> <todo label="Todo" href="todo.html" description="Todo List" /> <whole_foosite href="pdf-tab.html" label="pdf-tab" /> </about> ...
section.p: This allows you to link to it via a <link href="site:whole_foosite"> reference.
Add to every element that should be included in the pdf-tab.pdf the attribute wholesite="true". Like the following.
section.note: This attribute will be inherit by all chrildren of the element. Do not use it in the father element that contains the <whole_foosite href="pdf-tab.html" label="pdf-tab" /> as child (will cause a stack overflow when you do)!!!

section.title: Explanation of the operation
section.p:
Line 4 of our example
<map:parameter name="include" value="//*[@wholesite='true']"/> looks at your site.xml and will match every element containing the wholesite="true" attribute. Imaging you want the samples tab exported:
It matches all the elements that contains wholesite="true" - in our example <samples> and its "children" - for the content of the pdf file to be generated.

Line 8 defines the title of the pdf file by taking the content of the project-name variable in skinconf.xml and adding some funny text:
<map:parameter name="title" value="{conf:project-name}: Still My Foo Site"/>
section.note:
In the original aggregate.xmap there is the line
<map:parameter name="ignore" value="{1}"/>
just before the title definition (<map:parameter name="title" value=".../>). Be sure to delete it or comment it out if you like to generate a pdf-file for specific sites. You only need it for the generation of one pdf-file for the whole project (this is what aggregate.xmap usually does).
